intro: Cupaniopsis myrmoctona, commonly known as the Weeping Cupaniopsis, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is characterized by its drooping branches and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by native animals. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salinity and wind exposure. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
